result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachariah NMI Albert

defendant.name: Albert, Zachariah NMI
defendant.address: 920 Sharptail Run Street, New Richmond, WI 54017

records.addlTxt:
Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and ETG testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

1:01 PM Apprs: Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann for S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris,  Defendant Zachariah NMI Albert in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Zachariah NMI Albert.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE does qualify for PD.  Waives reading.  NG to both counts. Atty Schmidt does not request speedy trial at this time.  Bond argument.  Court orders bond and schedules next court date. Adjourned at 1:09 PM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
